# butter.sh

**Unlimited. Independent. Fresh.**

*A modern bash ecosystem for developers who demand more*

[![Organization](https://img.shields.io/badge/org-butter--sh-4ade80?style=for-the-badge&logo=github&logoColor=white)](https://github.com/butter-sh)
[![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-86efac?style=for-the-badge)](LICENSE)
[![Ecosystem](https://img.shields.io/badge/ecosystem-6_projects-22c55e?style=for-the-badge)](#projects)
[![Fresh](https://img.shields.io/badge/status-fresh-4ade80?style=for-the-badge&logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](#)

---

### *Build. Deploy. Document. Test. ‚Äî All in Bash.*

</div>

## üéØ What is butter.sh?

**butter.sh** is a collection of powerful, interconnected bash tools designed to streamline your development workflow. No bloat, no dependencies hell‚Äîjust pure, efficient bash scripting at its finest.

We believe in:
- üöÄ **Unlimited** potential in bash scripting
- üîì **Independent** tools that work together seamlessly  
- üßà **Fresh** approaches to old problems

---

### üì¶ arty.sh
[![Build Status](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/butter-sh/arty.sh/test.yml?branch=main&style=flat-square&logo=github)](https://github.com/butter-sh/arty.sh/actions)

**Install bash libraries from Git repositories**

Complete dependency management for bash projects with YAML configuration, setup hooks, and binary linking.

**Release cycle management for arty.sh projects**

Complete release automation with semantic versioning, changelog generation, git hooks, and monorepo support.

---

## üé¨ See It In Action

### Installing arty.sh and Managing Dependencies

```bash
# Quick install arty.sh
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/butter-sh/arty.sh/main/arty.sh | sudo tee /usr/local/bin/arty > /dev/null
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/arty

# Initialize a new project
arty init my-awesome-project
cd my-awesome-project

# Install dependencies
arty install https://github.com/butter-sh/kompose.sh.git
arty deps

# List installed libraries
arty list

# Execute library commands
arty exec kompose --help
```

### Generating Projects with hammer.sh

```bash
# Install hammer.sh via arty.sh
arty install https://github.com/butter-sh/hammer.sh.git

# List available templates
arty exec hammer --list

# Generate a new project
arty exec hammer starter my-project

# Generate with arty template
arty exec hammer arty my-library-manager
cd my-library-manager

# Create documentation site
arty exec hammer leaf my-docs
cd my-docs
```

### Testing with judge.sh

```bash
# Install judge.sh
git clone https://github.com/butter-sh/judge.sh.git
cd judge.sh
./setup.sh

# Run tests
./judge.sh run

# Run with verbose output
./judge.sh run -v

# Update snapshots
./judge.sh run -u
```

### Creating Documentation with leaf.sh

```bash
# Install leaf.sh via arty.sh
arty install https://github.com/butter-sh/leaf.sh.git

# Generate documentation for a project
arty exec leaf /path/to/your/project

# Generate with custom output
arty exec leaf . -o ./public

# Features:
# ‚ú® Responsive design with modern themes
# üé® Syntax highlighting
# üåì Dark/light theme support
# üì± Mobile-friendly
# üöÄ Auto-parses README, LICENSE, and source files
```

---

## üöÄ Quick Start

### Install Core Tools

```bash
# Install arty.sh (dependency manager)
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/butter-sh/arty.sh/main/arty.sh | sudo tee /usr/local/bin/arty > /dev/null
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/arty

# Install hammer.sh (project generator)
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/butter-sh/hammer.sh/main/hammer.sh | sudo tee /usr/local/bin/hammer > /dev/null
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/hammer

# Install whip.sh (release manager)
curl -sSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/butter-sh/whip.sh/main/whip.sh | sudo tee /usr/local/bin/whip > /dev/null
sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/whip
```

### Install via Git Clone

```bash
# Clone individual projects
git clone https://github.com/butter-sh/judge.sh.git
git clone https://github.com/butter-sh/leaf.sh.git
git clone https://github.com/butter-sh/myst.sh.git

# Or use arty.sh to manage them
arty init my-project
cd my-project
arty install https://github.com/butter-sh/judge.sh.git
arty install https://github.com/butter-sh/leaf.sh.git
arty install https://github.com/butter-sh/myst.sh.git
```

---

## üí° Example Workflow

Here's how butter.sh tools work together:

```bash
# 1. Generate a new library project with hammer.sh
hammer arty my-awesome-lib
cd my-awesome-lib

# 2. Write your bash library
cat > my-awesome-lib.sh << 'EOF'
#!/usr/bin/env bash
awesome_function() {
    echo "üßà Butter makes everything better!"
}
EOF

# 3. Install judge.sh for testing
arty install https://github.com/butter-sh/judge.sh.git

# 4. Create tests with judge.sh
cat > test_lib.sh << 'EOF'
#!/usr/bin/env bash
source "$(arty source judge.sh)/test-helpers.sh"
source my-awesome-lib.sh

log_section "Awesome library tests"
setup_test_env

log_test "should be awesome"
result=$(awesome_function)
assert_contains "$result" "Butter"

cleanup_test_env
print_test_summary
EOF

# 5. Run tests
arty exec judge run

# 6. Install leaf.sh for documentation
arty install https://github.com/butter-sh/leaf.sh.git

# 7. Generate documentation
arty exec leaf .

# 8. Install whip.sh for releases
arty install https://github.com/butter-sh/whip.sh.git

# 9. Create a release
arty exec whip release patch

# 10. Use your library in another project
cd ..
arty init consumer-project
cd consumer-project
arty install ../my-awesome-lib

# 11. Use it
cat > main.sh << 'EOF'
#!/usr/bin/env bash
source <(arty source my-awesome-lib)
awesome_function
EOF

bash main.sh
# Output: üßà Butter makes everything better!
```

---

## üé® Features That Make Us Different

### üéØ Zero Dependencies
Every tool in the butter.sh ecosystem is pure bash. No npm, no pip, no cargo‚Äîjust bash and common Unix tools.

### üîó Seamless Integration  
Tools are designed to work together but remain completely independent. Use one, use all‚Äîyour choice.

### ‚ö° Lightning Fast
Bash is fast. Really fast. No startup time, no compilation, no JVM warmup.

### üì¶ Package Management Done Right
`arty.sh` brings modern dependency management to bash without the bloat of traditional package managers.

### üé® Beautiful Output
Colorful, informative, and user-friendly CLI interfaces that make bash development a joy.

### üß™ Test-Driven Development
`judge.sh` brings assertion libraries and snapshot testing to bash‚Äîyes, really!

### üìö Documentation First
`leaf.sh` generates stunning documentation websites from your bash projects automatically.

### üî® Rapid Prototyping
`hammer.sh` scaffolds complete projects in seconds with customizable templates.

---

## üèóÔ∏è Architecture

```
butter.sh ecosystem
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üì¶ arty.sh          ‚Üí Dependency management & library installation
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Install from Git repositories
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ YAML-based configuration (arty.yml)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Setup hooks for initialization
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Binary linking for executables
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üî® hammer.sh        ‚Üí Project scaffolding & generation
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Built-in templates (arty, starter, leaf, judge, myst, whip)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Variable substitution
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Smart overwrite handling
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Custom template support
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üõ°Ô∏è judge.sh        ‚Üí Testing framework
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Rich assertion library
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Snapshot testing
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Colorful output
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ CI/CD integration
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ üçÉ leaf.sh         ‚Üí Documentation generation
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Markdown to HTML
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Syntax highlighting
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Responsive design
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Dark/light theme
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Powered by myst.sh
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚ú® myst.sh         ‚Üí Templating engine
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Mustache-style syntax
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Template inheritance
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Partials support
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Multiple input formats (JSON, YAML, ENV)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Embeddable as library
‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ üéØ whip.sh         ‚Üí Release management
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Semantic versioning (major/minor/patch)
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Changelog generation from git
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Git hooks with validation  
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Monorepo batch operations
```

---

## üåü Why butter.sh?

### For Bash Developers
- **Modern tooling** for an ancient language
- **Dependency management** that actually works
- **Testing frameworks** to catch bugs early
- **Documentation** that writes itself

### For DevOps Engineers
- **No runtime dependencies** to manage
- **Lightning fast** execution
- **CI/CD ready** out of the box
- **Portable** across all Unix systems

### For Open Source Maintainers
- **Beautiful project pages** generated automatically
- **Comprehensive testing** without complexity
- **Easy contribution** with clear project structure
- **Professional appearance** that builds trust

---

## üìñ Documentation

Each project has comprehensive documentation:

- **[arty.sh](https://github.com/butter-sh/arty.sh)** - Dependency management
- **[hammer.sh](https://github.com/butter-sh/hammer.sh)** - Project generator
- **[judge.sh](https://github.com/butter-sh/judge.sh)** - Testing framework
- **[leaf.sh](https://github.com/butter-sh/leaf.sh)** - Documentation generator
- **[myst.sh](https://github.com/butter-sh/myst.sh)** - Templating engine
- **[whip.sh](https://github.com/butter-sh/whip.sh)** - Release management

## ü§ù Contributing

We love contributions! Each project accepts PRs:

1. **Fork** the repository
2. **Create** a feature branch (`git checkout -b feature/amazing`)
3. **Commit** your changes (`git commit -m '‚ú® Add amazing feature'`)
4. **Push** to the branch (`git push origin feature/amazing`)
5. **Open** a Pull Request

### Areas We Need Help With

- üìù Documentation improvements
- üêõ Bug fixes and issue reports
- ‚ú® New features and enhancements
- üé® New templates for hammer.sh
- üß™ More test cases for judge.sh
- üåç Internationalization
